properties.areaDesc: Northern Dona Ana County; Central Tularosa Basin; Sierra County Lakes
properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 9:16AM MST until February 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM EXPECTED TO BRING HEAVY SNOW OVER MOUNTAIN
AREAS...

Upper level closed low is expected to combine with a strong cold
front to bring winter weather conditions over the Gila Region and
Sacramento Mountains today through early Wednesday morning.
Temperatures will drop below freezing behind the front which will
allow the transition from rain to snow. Periods of moderate to
heavy snow are possible with this system resulting in snow
accumulations of 6 to 10(+) inches in the Sacramento Mountains,
and areas above 7500 feet in the Gila Region, with isolated
higher amounts possible. The snow should end by Wednesday
morning.

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches.

* WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico.

* WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Portions of the Rio Grande Valley and
Tularosa Basin have been recently included. Light snow
accumulations are likely across the desert floor.

* TIMING... Occasional moderate to heavy snow through early
Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS... Travel could become difficult as roadways may be
slick and snow covered.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY
